entries.meaning: A point or place where a check is performed, especially a point along a road or on a frontier where travellers are stopped for inspection
examples: The travellers were stopped at the checkpoint.

entries.meaning: (computing) A situation, often represented by a point in time, at which the state of a database system is known to be valid, and to which it can be returned in the event of a crisis by using a combination of backups and logs; the data stored at this event.
examples: After the crash, we rolled back the database to the last checkpoint.

entries.meaning: (video games) A predetermined point in a map, level or scenario that the player may resume from if they die or restart from if they choose to.
examples: You can't finish the race if you haven't passed all of the checkpoints on the track.

verbs.description: checkpoint (third-person singular simple present checkpoints, present participle checkpointing, simple past and past participle checkpointed)
